problem_text:
For a finite group G let Cod(G) denote the set of irreducible character codegrees of G (see 20.78). Define σ(G) = max{|π(m)| : m ∈Cod(G)}, where π(m) denotes the set of prime divisors of an integer m.
It is proved that there exists a constant k such that |π(G)| ⩽k · σ(G) for every finite group G (Y. Yang, G. Qian, J. Algebra, 478 (2017), 215–219), but the estimate provided for k is very crude. Can the constant k be taken as 4?
G. Qian
